message: The 29-hour cycle is the *default* setting, so it applies on a brand-new install of IIS (unless you explicitly change it). You can turn it off; however, ASP.NET does have situations (such as unexpected client disconnects) where it will Thread.Abort request threads for synchronous requests, so your AppDomain may eventually de-stabalize. For this reason I believe it's best to leave the default recycling on.
